page.title: 15 Barnwell Entertainers
page.content:
Barnwell Entertainers are having a good year in 1985. Post-Christmas revellers enjoyed their fourth annual pantomime, "Cinderella", in January. Six months later, in June, came their ever-so-slightly-saucy production of "The Continental Quilt" - a bedroom farce in which the goings on in a bachelor flat caused much merriment for three appreciative full house audiences. Plans are now under way for the next pantomime, which will doubtless be the most splendid yet, as the 5m x 3m stage creaks and the walls of the Reading Room expand to accommodate almost the whole population of Barnwell.
[Anne Parkes Producer & Founder Member]
